alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 9:34PM EDT until April 08 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Flint River near Flint River near Griffin affecting Fayette and Spalding Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Flint River near Griffin... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flint River near Flint River near Griffin. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 12 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands...fields and pasture upstream and downstream from the gage on Georgia Highway 16 or Newnan Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EDT Thursday the stage was 12.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EDT Thursday was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 5.2 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 12 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
